trial_identification.studytitle: An evaluation of the Garden to Table project in low decile Wellington schools.
trial_identification.scientifictitle: An evaluation of the Garden to Table project in low decile primary school children on diet quality and body weight.

interventions.interventions: Intervention children will attend Garden To Table classes weekly which includes planting and tending a vegetable garden, and cooking and eating the produce. Classes are once per week for one hour and run for the school year (4 terms). Classes are run by the GTT coordinator for that school, after training from the GTT national program.
interventions.comparator: The control children will not attend any form of gardening or cooking classes, they will receive standard schooling only.

primaryOutcome.outcome: Diet quality by childrens dietary questionnaire score
Waist circumference assessed by flexible tape measure

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Body fat percentage assessed by Tanita scale
Qualitative measures through focus groups, measuring change in childrens knowledge and preference toward fruit and vegetables, and a process evaluation at the end of the year of the GTT program.

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: CHildren in years 5 and 6, at low decile (3 or less) schools participating in the Garden to Table program.
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Children under the age of 7 or not participating in the GTT classes for whatever reason.

trial_design.concealment: Information sheets will be sent to all classes in the Garden to table program. Parents/caregivers who choose for their child to participate will sign consent form.

sponsorship.primarysponsorname: Capital and Coast District Health Board

ethicsAndSummary.summary: To evaluate the Garden to Table (GTT) project in 3 low decile primary schools in Wellington for an effect on diet quality and anthropometric measures.

ethicscommitee.ethicname: Central Health and Disability Ethics Committee
ethicscommitee.ethicaddress: Ministry of Health No 1 The Terrace PO Box 5013 Wellington 6021
